title: Bashful Mr. Brown [The Corrick Collection]
other_title: The Bashful Mr Brown [Restored Version] : Corrick Collection # 16
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Perth (W.A.) - Description and travel
abstract: The Corricks first film, a silent chase-comedy made soon after they acquired their first motion picture camera, starring various members of the troupe.
description: Shot in Perth, this is likely the first dramatic narrative film produced in Western Australia. 'Bashful Mr Brown' depicts the awkwardness of a young bachelor in his endeavour to help his hostess dispense afternoon tea.  After many accidents including his flight from the garden with the afternoon teacloth attached to his coat-tails, he's pursued by a number of small boys where he finally manages to climb into a passing cart and takes refuge in a barrel labeled 'Fat'. Mr. Brown was likely played by company funny-man Chris Young, and in typical self-promoting fashion, a poster advertising the Corrick Family Entertainers is seen pasted on a street hoarding during the chase sequence. Source: West Australian, Perth Monday 11 March 1907.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002470; Presenting the Corrick Collection; Active; 2011
